doc1.title: Intro to Code
doc1.description: An introduction to the basic concepts of computational thinking and code: algorithms, decomposition, logic and abstraction.

doc1.title: Scratch Course Summary
doc1.description: A summary of the Scratch Lesson Plans, including core competencies and lesson outlines.

doc2.title: Scratch Lesson Plans
doc2.description: Students will learn how to describe what is code, how to navigate the Scratch website and how to utilize Scratch resources. They will develop computational thinking skills to actively participate in the digital world.

doc1.title: HTML/CSS Handout
doc1.description: An introduction to common HTML and CSS tags.

doc2.title: HTML/CSS Lesson Plans
doc2.description: Student will learn about how the Internet works, what is a computer and how they can create their own content for the Internet.

doc1.title: Python Lesson 1
doc1.description: An introduction to the basic concepts of coding and to the Python programming language.

doc2.title: Python Lesson 2
doc2.description: Students will learn about Python’s turtle, functions,comments, errors and common commands through discussion and practice.

doc3.title: Python Lesson 3
doc3.description: Students will learn to code a basic snowflake and how to use loops, variables and integers through discussion and practice.

doc4.title: Python Lesson 4
doc4.description: Students will practice coding snowflakes using different functions and variables.

doc5.title: Python Lesson 6
doc5.description: Students will learn about mathematical operators and lists through discussion and practice.

doc6.title: Python Lesson 2
doc6.description: Students will learn about Python’s turtle, functions,comments, errors and common commands through discussion and practice.

doc7.title: Python Lesson 7
doc7.description: Students will learn about while loops through discussion and practice.

doc8.title: Python Lesson 8
doc8.description: Students will integrate game logic, user input, while loops and random integers to create a game of their choosing.

doc1.title: Introduction to HTML
doc1.description: Students will learn the basic concepts of HTML (Hyper Text Markup Language).

doc2.title: Algorithm Activity 1: Ping-Pong Rescue
doc2.description: Students will work in teams of 2 to 4 to create a simple algorithm that guides one of their team members, who is blindfolded, to rescue a ping-pong ball.

doc3.title: Algorithm Activity 2: Pizza Recipes
doc3.description: Students will first engage in an interactive quiz in which they start to see how logic can be used to design complex algorithms. Afterwards, they will demonstrate their understanding by using logic to construct their favorite pizza recipes.

doc4.title: Algorithm Activity 3: Scavenger Hunt
doc4.description: Students will continue to apply the concepts of complex algorithms by​ ​designing​ ​and​ ​participating​ ​in a scavenger hunt.

doc5.title: Choose Your Own Adventure
doc5.description: Students will explore the various types of algorithms by designing and developing their own interactive Choose Your Own Adventure stories.

doc6.title: IIntroduction to CSS
doc6.description: Students will learn the basic concepts of CSS (Cascading Style Sheet) and develop an understanding of the relationships between HTML markup and CSS declarations.

doc7.title: Unplugged User Stories
doc7.description: Students will learn how to identify features and components of complex systems by constructing user stories.

doc1.title: Introduction to Visual Programming using Twine
doc1.description: Students will begin to explore how to design algorithms using a visual programming language called Twine.

doc2.title: Real-World Modelling with Wireframes
doc2.description: Students will model an existing website or mobile app by creating wireframes​.
